data.title: Reviews of Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
data.meta_description: Reviews of Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
data.text:
Definitely weaker than big boy Burton's 2010 remake, and one of the less engaging adaptations I've seen- but it deserves some merit and has it's moments. Thank you for reading, and I hope you are all well.

An excessively melodramatic performance by Tod Slaughter carries this otherwise unremarkable adaptation of the classic serial killer story. The trapdoor to the basement was a nice touch, the love story was as basic as they come. All in all, it's a movie that's so cartoonish and over-the-top that it is hard to take seriously as a horror movie by today's standards, but it's not devoid of macabre fun.

As Bellatrix sang gleefully...

Mind you, I can hardly blame them

These are probably the worst pies in London

I know why nobody cares to take them

I should know, I make 'em

But good?

No, the worst pies in London, even that's polite

The worst pies in London

If you doubt it, take a bite

Tim Burton's version of this classic old tale is the one if you ask me.
